website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay a premium for this smart alarm that just isn't very smart. HomeKit's first smoke detector is one to avoid until it gets a few major software updates.
pros: First Alert shows off its hardware pedigree with the OneLink by First Alert Wi-Fi Smoke and CO Alarm
The device looks good, and responds to smoke quickly and consistently
cons: The HomeKit integration doesn't add anything and the unresponsive app takes quite a bit away from this supposedly smart smoke detector
Both the push notifications and the in-app silencing feature are too slow to be useful

customer_reviews.title: This alarm has been a disaster for us. A ...
customer_reviews.text: This alarm has been a disaster for us. A the time I purchased it, this alarm was the only one that would meet our city permit requirements: 10-year battery and linked wirelessly. One after another these units have failed. Usually in pairs they will start going off or saying they have reached end of life. They won't stop even after disabled. First Alert keeps replacing them but it is not worth the trouble. About to call and get 4 replaced again and hope they have fixed the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All 3 failed silently after less than 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for my mother's home in Jan 2016 when she was 95. Seemed ideal until all 3 of them stopped working completely with no alert or message. They just stopped working. I don't know how long they lasted before silently failing but I just tested all 3 of them and they are dead. I feel that owning these smoke detectors created a dangerous situation for my mother, who was 90 minutes away from me. I was counting on First Alert. I will never own a First Alert product again.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer75

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install with the iOS app.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up so skip the “pay to install” option. I selected this one over other products because it was compatible with Apple HomeKit. The setup was great and the app leads you through step-by-step. The alarms and announcements are clear and explicit. I had only purchased one to see how thinks went with installation. Ordered another one as soon as I installed the first.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these because they were the only HomeKit-ready smoke detectors on the market. The setup was very easy and straightforward, and the first few days were uneventful. Then all heck broke loose. These have malfunctioned for four days straight, consistently going off 7-8 times per day. I've tried every recommendation from First Alert customer service with no improvement. Even more comical is the fact that I still have not received a single notification in the iOS Home app over four days (and 25-30 alarms). Needless to say, I just shipped them back to Amazon for a compete refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE - Dumbest Smart Alarm - Barely Works
customer_reviews.text: Update: Doesn't stay paired. Help desk phone path leads to hang up every time. I bought 3 and each took about a dozen attempts before pairing with the phone. They show as incompatible with the Apple Home Kit even after firmware updates. Nothing about the smart features are really needed. Save some $$$ and get a solid dumb alarm for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Works, setup could be better
customer_reviews.text: Need to setup through the app. I set up through the Home App and it connected and seemingly worked ok, but wouldn't apply the firmware update. Reset twice and finally worked setting up and updating in the app. There is a battery level indicator and it says it is at 100%. I'll monitor to see if depletes as others have indicated it does.
customer_reviews.author: boydmj

customer_reviews.title: Firmware for Apple HomeKit Home app not ready.
customer_reviews.text: Beware, beware, beware. Bought three of them to find out they are not supported by Apple Homekit Home" app. Called and was told that it is coming in a firmware update. Quandary. Do I send back now or wait for the update which may come after the time limit for sending back.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Detects when nothing is there!!
customer_reviews.text: Product was horrendous! It kept beeping at random times alerting that there was a problem and then go away! Then one night go off for a carbon and we called fire and their was no carbon! Moved to another brand and I’m much happier!!
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Babygirl

customer_reviews.title: its not working with home kit
customer_reviews.text: its not working with home kit, because this model is 5 years old. and that was nowhere noted. Needs a factory update, and this seems to be impossible. So i can throw it away and buy another model.
customer_reviews.author: Johan Stegmeijer

customer_reviews.title: Initial problems but ultimately works fine
customer_reviews.text: The original ones sent to me could not update their software, and therefore did not work with HomeKit. The company was very helpful and sent me new ones that were already updated and work well.
customer_reviews.author: jamosc

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Onelink wireless smoke and Co2 alarm. Downloaded the app, followed all instructions blue flashing lights to connect then nothing. Did not connect and end of any help on app! NOT happy and no really customer support phone number. Expensive and no DIY project.
customer_reviews.author: PKD

customer_reviews.title: End of life
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone else, I got the end of life warning after 6 months I bought it. Unfortunately, I have this unit installed in my home - in TAIWAN. I'm going to contact their customer services to see what they can do for me. July 20 update: After contact with their customer service, they sent a replacement to Taiwan and I got it today. I'm going to activate it and see how long will it last.
customer_reviews.author: Wai-Hen Lam

customer_reviews.title: If you want to die in a fire this product is for you.
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money! Disconnects frequently and to make matters worse it totally died in exactly 83 days. So basically this junk cost me a little over a dollar a day to own. UNACCEPTABLE First Alert. You should be embarrassed to put your name on this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Warkman

customer_reviews.title: Wanna beta test an alarm system and pay $100+ to do so? This is your lucky day.
customer_reviews.text: Was on the phone for an hour with "Jules". The item will see my router. The router sees the device. The Bluetooth connects. But it will not enter that last critical phase where it... You know... Works. My favorite part was where she tried to dissuade me from returning the item because the "tech guys" really like to trouble shoot the problems with new devices. In short, we are beta testing this system. THIS IS SUPPOSED TO BE A SMOKE ALARM!! Tech companies that half bake systems and have them tested by customers is unconscionable.
customer_reviews.author: X Y & Z artist

customer_reviews.title: Unless you like things that don't work, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: The first set I got, failed almost immediately. The company swiftly sent me a replacement. The second set failed within two months. First one, then the other. These are supposed to last ten years. Between the two sets, I didn't get one full year of use. They constantly uncoupled from the wifi, freaking out the entire house. The initial set up sucked and took hours when it should have taken ten minutes, max. Setting them up four times was expected but after that, seriously a waste of time. The app is also crap. Now, even with them disconnected and deactivated, they are still yelling at us. Tonight they can yell at us from the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Anthro

customer_reviews.title: avoid!
customer_reviews.text: My First Alert OneLink freaked out one day, about a month after install. The alarm sounded for no reason and started making deranged announcements and noises, ultimately settling on the initial Welcome message that it repeated about hourly. The app on my iPhone no longer recognized the device nor that it even existed. 'Had to email Jarden (First Alert is the same company that makes Mr. Coffee, Yankee Candle, etc.; !), which arranged for me to return the device and promised a refund (which has not yet arrived). I have now replaced the device with Nest, which appears to be working quite well with easy set-up and install.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Quite working 3 Months and 3 days later
customer_reviews.text: The install and setup were pretty simple and straight forward. BUT, one month and 3 days after I ordered the Smoke Detector, (30 day return policy on Amazon) it quit working. Not a good way to protect my family.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Moma

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst products I've purchased. Unwanted alerts and unfriendly setup process.
customer_reviews.author: Zeph McLearan

customer_reviews.title: Worst quality
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after three months. No repair or return option. Basically useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3 only 1 was actually new, two others were previuosly used.
customer_reviews.text: These have a sealed battery good for ten years. Bought 3 and opened them to find out two of them had been previously installed and returned... Essentially making these maybe 9 year batteries now.
customer_reviews.author: nicolas Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi by First Alert
customer_reviews.text: Had to return four of these units. Customer service was great. Return was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis G. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one month. We went on vacation and our house sitter said the unit was continually talking, he removed the unit, was not able to get the unit to stop speaking, put the unit in the basement so not to hear it. A few days later we returned from vacation, I attempted to reinstall and it appears the 10 year built in battery is dead. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: J. hoffecker

customer_reviews.title: No notification, false alarms, bad UI
customer_reviews.text: Was triggered twice by steam from the shower, not smoke, the second time without even the red light, and didn't get a push notification on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: M. V.

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup
customer_reviews.text: Installation and setup we quick and easy I love how loud it is and how it talks to you. I have read all the reviews and I hope i don't have those issues, but it has only been 1 day I will be updating this review in about a week
customer_reviews.author: Nsiddons

customer_reviews.title: Not yet HomeKit compatibile
customer_reviews.text: I buy this device because I would want a device Apple HomeKit compatible, but .... it is not yet compatibile ....
customer_reviews.author: Giancarlo F.

customer_reviews.title: Photoelectric detector only
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this alarm is photoelectric only (slow fires) Nowhere on the packaging or website does it state this - you have to read the manual to discover it. You'd think for such a price, it would detect photo and ionization fires (fast flaming like paper burning in a trash can). So, for the price, you're not as protected as you may think..
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: It looks fine, it is wired to AC and the phone ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this several months ago. Two or so months ago, it beeped (of course, in the middle of the night) saying "Detector Error in Kitchen" and three more beeps a few minutes later. It looks fine, it is wired to AC and the phone shows no problems, so no idea what the error could be. It then did the same thing on Saturday. Then Sunday night (1230am) then Monday evening (1030pm). They're sending me a new one, but I've already purchased a Nest. Problem is the rest of my alarms (10 total) are wired FirstAlerts, and 10 Nest Protects won't be cheap...
customer_reviews.author: K. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not ready for prime time. I purchased 2 of these units. One of them did not work, then the replacements failed i.e. began to chirp after 6 weeks. The deactivation switches failed to turn them off. The company replaced both-quickly-then the replacements did exactly the same thing. Maybe by version 3 they may have gotten it sorted out. Until then don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Otagokiwi

customer_reviews.title: First and replacement units died after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even want to put a single star to rate this defective product. This company does not invest in quality control. I bought a unit from Apple online and the battery died after 2 days. I contacted First Alert to report the issue and they were happy to send me a replacement. Only thing was, the replacement unit also died after 2 days. First Alert call center agent could only say I had a bad luck. Two defective units in a row--coincidence or just plain defective? Apple should suspend this product from HomeKit until First Alert fixes their battery issue.
customer_reviews.author: DDF

customer_reviews.title: All dead within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Same as many of the other reviews, bought 4 in late November, right after launch. One would never complete the initialization process, the last one died yesterday. They are clearly junk.
customer_reviews.author: rmc

customer_reviews.title: Not as mature as the Nest
customer_reviews.text: This is for iOS (not Android). It's also photoelectric only (slow fires). Having a 10 year battery on the First Alert Onelink is nice, though once you activate the battery, there's no turning it back off. The setup code is on the backside of the product, so set it up before installing. It's all-or-nothing, like a traditional detector. No intermediate level warning. Overall, this is worse than the NEST PROTECT. The setup is more cumbersome, the voice and speakers are worse,
customer_reviews.author: Mido

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.text: This product should not be allowed to be sold on Amazon. It is defective. These should have all been recalled.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these.
customer_reviews.text: Junk! We bought 5 of these, and after a year, none of them work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this brand of smoke and carbon monoxide detectors for years and they've always been consistent performers at a reasonable price. This model claims a ten year battery which...is possible...ten years, really? However, I'm delighted by the prospect of not having to change batteries. As far as sounding an alarm on my phone through an app, I suspect that this appeals to some people. It doesn't capture me in any way, tbh. Thus, I am left with wondering if the price tag of $119 merits not changing the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Theseus

customer_reviews.title: Convenience overcomes weaknesses.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cool all-in-one smoke detector/carbon monoxide alarm that will talk to apple products via the web when it goes off. It easy to set up, has a ten year life span (or so it claims) and never need batteries - after ten years you toss it. There are some weaknesses. No Android app yet. And the best place for a smoke alarm is high (where smoke goes) while the best place for a Carbon Monoxide alarm is low, catch it before it gets to head level. So, not perfect -- but still, pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Demeritt

customer_reviews.title: High tech!
customer_reviews.text: Extra degree of protection here. A smoke detector and carbon monoxide detector in one unit. The real bonus is that it can be used with your smart phone for early warnings. This is a well-made and nicely styled smoke detector/carbon monoxide detector that requires no checking of the batteries. I like that idea! Every home should have smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors as well. This will enhance your protection.
customer_reviews.author: Vista Bill Raley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far and looks nice on the wall!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: The alarm has great features and would be excellent in the home but ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to give a negative review. The alarm has great features and would be excellent in the home but we do not have apple products therefore, I cannot give it an accurate review. I do love all of the features.
customer_reviews.author: momofmany

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the worst! We've had to replace it 3 times because it malfunctions. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: James D Simon

customer_reviews.title: Onelink Wi-Fi Smoke + Carbon Monoxide Alarm, Battery, Apple HomeKit-enabled
customer_reviews.text: When I originally ordered this Smoke and Carbon Monoxide detector, nowhere on the data page did it mention it was not compatible with any Android devices. Since I have no Apple devices and only Android, the WiFi functions on this alarm are useless. I see that the description and technical specs have since been updated on the page, although a little late on the info for me.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Kilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: What if wifi and iOS go down ?
customer_reviews.text: nice idea...but should make wifi and iOS optional.....what if you don't have either and just needed the connected alarms .....what if you dropped your wifi and sold your iOS.....what is wifi and iOS was down.....etc.
customer_reviews.author: mrbasicshark

customer_reviews.title: NOT ANDROID COMPATIBLE!  Seriously, no app in the google play store-unable to set it up, ridiculous!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously - NOT ANDROID COMPATIBLE? In this day and age? I know the description said homekit compatible, but it doesn't say apple ecosystem only. Very disappointed and can't understand why they would do this, I have wifi thermostats, locks, garage door openers, light switches and everything else that is fully compatible with android, but not this ridiculous smoke detector? Come on! How hard woujld it be to develop an android app for it? It's worthless to me because I have no apple devices and refuse to buy apple devices. And you can't initialize it and set it up without an iPhone or ipad. Guess I will be purchasing only Nest Protect smoke alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. T

product_meta.title: Onelink Wi-Fi Smoke + Carbon Monoxide Alarm, Battery, Apple HomeKit-enabled
product_meta.description: The home kit-enabled one link by First Alert Wi-Fi smoke+carbon monoxide alarm and the free one link home app on your iPhone or iPad work for your peace of mind, so you know your home is safer and truly just one link away. This alarm will detect and alert you in the event of a smoke or carbon monoxide emergency. With the one link by First Alert Wi-Fi smoke+carbon monoxide alarm you can forget about battery replacements because this alarm doesn't need them. This alarm was designed to last for 10 years, the longest time permitted by the national fire code. This product is intended for non-professional do it yourself installation. The alarm is included in the Green builder's 2016 hot 50 product list due in part because of its 10-year sealed battery, which increases sustainability by reducing battery waste, and because of its connectivity and collaboration to a smart home. If you would like information about a professionally installed and monitored system, please contact First Alert professional. First Alert professional is not affiliated with bark brands, Inc. One link by First Alert. Always connected. Always protected.
feature_bullets: Wi-Fi Smoke and Carbon Monoxide Alarm is HomeKit-enabled to send notifications to your Apple device (requires iOS 9.0 or later)
Combination smoke detector/carbon monoxide alarm detects 2 threats
10-year sealed battery ensures consistent protection for the lifetime of the alarm
Can connect with compatible alarms via Bluetooth (additional alarms sold separately)
Voice alarm can be programmed to announce where and what the threat is

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.3 out of 5 stars85 ratings2.3 out of 5 stars
